column4: my ubuntu has changed.. what did i do.. i lost my audio button on the toolbar at the top of the screen.
either it crashes, or you accidently removed it while removing other stuff from the panel.
ubuntu-tweak has a tool to totally reset all settings
or play with teh appearance settings to get what you like
what are you talking about?
theres a way to add custome nautilus menu items, via teh nautilus scripts. but you may have to research it a little bit.
i recall there being some nautiuls python menu package/tool out also that added some neat menu items/features as well.
http://www.giuspen.com/nautilus-pyextensions/ , i alwo recall ubuntu-tweak had some extras for the menus as well.
its not clear what youa re looking for excactly.
you want to duplicate teh windows7 libraries feature then is what you are saying.
i think theres some 'fuse' tools that could sort of emulate that effect.
Fuse is a very powerfull   thing.t hat has dozens of 'special' filesystems
unionfs-fuse sort of does what you want. but it willneed some configiraton
hmm?
sudo apt-get install unionfs-fuse and check its docs/man page.. ive neer used  that specific fuse fs.
ive NO idea where you came up with 'run install-sh' from...
you are doing it totally wrong.
use the package manager tool to install the unionfs-fuse package.
---------------------->    sudo apt-get install unionfs-fuse and check its docs/man page.. ive neer used  that specific fuse fs.
a shell script can be any of several dozen languages in linux.
windows.bat = dos commands.
thats the codename for the beta version i think.
